basics.name: C.M. (Kees) Nederhoff, Ph.D.
basics.label: Coastal Scientist | Natural Hazard and Risk Engineering
basics.summary: Coastal scientist specializing in compound flooding, tropical cyclone hazards, and climate adaptation. Recent PhD from Delft University (2024). Principal Investigator on $6M+ in federal research funding from USGS, ONR, NOAA, and ERDC. Co-developer of SFINCS flood model used in 20+ countries. Published 32 peer-reviewed articles (h-index 19, 1,361 citations) advancing physics-based flood modeling and nature-based coastal resilience. Supervised 23 graduate students across six research universities.

research_impact.software: Co-developer SFINCS flood model (20+ countries, 950+ downloads)

work.name: Deltares USA
work.summary: Principal Investigator on $6M+ in federal research grants advancing compound flooding science, tropical cyclone forecasting, and coastal hazard assessment
highlights: Published 32 peer-reviewed articles (h-index 19, 1,361 citations) in Nature Climate Change, Coastal Engineering, and Natural Hazards and Earth System Sciences
Co-developed SFINCS flood model now operational in 20+ countries and adopted by USGS CoSMoS and U.S. Navy forecasting systems
Supervised 23 graduate students (7 PhD, 16 MS) resulting in 6 peer-reviewed publications
Led $1M+ in applied coastal modeling projects for regional hazard assessment and wetland restoration in San Francisco Bay
Completed PhD in Coastal Engineering at Delft University (2024) while maintaining full-time research program

work.name: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS)
work.summary: Co-lead development of Coastal Storm Modeling System (CoSMoS) assessing compound flooding impacts for 100+ million U.S. coastal residents
highlights: Principal Investigator on $3.8M USGS research portfolio including CoSMoS nationwide expansion, MODFLOW groundwater model development, and regional hazard assessments
Developed integrated methodologies coupling storm surge, wave overtopping, riverine discharge, and shallow groundwater for urban estuarine flooding
Co-authored federal reports and high-impact publications including Nature Climate Change paper on Southeast Atlantic multi-hazard projections
Trained USGS staff nationwide in SFINCS, CoSMoS, XBeach, and Delft3D applications

work.name: Stichting Deltares Netherlands
work.summary: Developed and validated process-based coastal models (Delft3D, XBeach, SWAN) for storm surge, wave-driven morphodynamics, and compound flooding
highlights: Led synthetic tropical cyclone modeling innovation later formalized in PhD research
Guest lecturer at TU Delft and IHE Delft teaching MSc coastal modeling courses (2015-2019)
Contributed to international projects with NOAA, World Bank, and coastal agencies globally
